conversation.content:
Id: d7f6981235b548d68554d
Description: The intent to view the version history of a file, including who made changes and when they were made.
Entity:
	Attribute-Id: 31bb730dfc224b699a73d
	Description: The name of the file whose version history needs to be viewed.

	Attribute-Id: 65a7814a438244ccb04d6
	Description: The specific version number of the file to view.

	Attribute-Id: 0161ca987ae84db6a9f3a
	Description: The date when the specific version of the file was last modified.
	Attribute-Example-values: ['2022-03-01', '2022-04-15', '2022-05-30']

	Attribute-Id: 757a4360e05a467eb8bda
	Description: The name of the user who last modified the specific version of the file.
	Attribute-Example-values: ['John Doe', 'Jane Smith', 'Alice Johnson']



Id: b664d40851ff43bdb1264
Description: The intent to retrieve a file from a remote server or cloud storage and save it to a local device.
Entity:
	Attribute-Id: 83feb28609674df594609
	Description: The name of the file to be downloaded.

	Attribute-Id: c4481812b8764e87a2e0e
	Description: The location where the file is stored for downloading. If an exact file path is given, include the whole file path.
	Attribute-Example-values: ['Google Drive', 'OneDrive', 'Dropbox', 'company server']

	Attribute-Id: b9cb281c2afe4201bb150
	Description: The local folder or directory where the file will be saved.



Id: f33fd1b7b92744b0bbcc0
Description: The intent to restore a previous version of a file, undoing changes that were made since that version was saved.
Entity:
	Attribute-Id: 1e43627b8aa54c86b8a8b
	Description: The name of the file for which the previous version needs to be restored.

	Attribute-Id: cb8c7285670c4e66993c8
	Description: The version number or date of the file version that needs to be restored.
	Attribute-Example-values: ['1.0', '2021-10-15']



Id: 4cbc46aec524439c99e57
Description: The intent to request permission to access a file or folder that is owned by another user or group.
Entity:
	Attribute-Id: 095731b2988b419297ca8
	Description: The type of file or folder being requested for access.

	Attribute-Id: e590bfad8ae94385b4af8
	Description: The level of access being requested for the file or folder.

	Attribute-Id: baaca7568c044ad8adc30
	Description: The user or group that owns the file or folder being requested for access.

Based on the list of intents above, your task is going to be to classify a statement and fill any attributes under that intent based on the content of the statement. If you come across a attribute that has no direct association in the statement, fill it with "0". Your response should be in nested python dictionaries that match the form of the intent list (JSON). IMPORTANT: only use the intent id to refer to the intent, not the description. Similarly, only refer to the attribute-id, never the name. If there are descriptions or names for intents and attributes in your output I will be upset. The dictionaries should also follow the structure of:

"intent": <id>,

"attributes":

{

attribute-id: value

...

}

Statement:

"Download file.txt from users/onedrive/files to desktop/files"
